description: Origin expedition to Mirado region. Led by a nameless savage woman with between 6 and 33 men (accounts vary). Three facts preserved about this expedition but details sparse.
outcome: Established first contact with Mirado region
chronicler_notes: Details unreliable. Oral transmission degraded accuracy. Woman's name deliberately omitted or lost.

description: Construction of Mirado City and the Tower. Rock sourced from Yeller Quarry. Represents major W1 architectural achievement.
outcome: Tower of Mirado constructed; city established
chronicler_notes: Quarry origin confirmed. Construction methods unknown. Tower's silver column origin disputed.

key_participants: The Colonel; Five Column Captains (Mell Gretl Temmen Orgo Tormon); Tower Council (Hudd Lekin Miklin); Fyncho; Borpo
description: Central military event. The Colonel led Capital forces assault on Tower of Mirado using Five Columns formation. Prolonged siege with desert alliance involvement (Borpo).
outcome: Colonel gained control of Tower region
chronicler_notes: Extensive documentation. Some propaganda elements suspected. Tower-side records unavailable.

description: Failed expedition to boundary region under Algorithmic Expedition Initiative protocols. Disaster occurred in Sector DE-7.
chronicler_notes: Maren Drusk's systematic protocols failed at boundary conditions. Investigation ongoing. Vass Tonner critics vindicated.

description: Traumatic encounter between scholar Grigsu Haldo and the creature Yeller. Details preserved in Grigsu's Notebooks (entry 007). Led to scholar's psychological deterioration and eventual death near Quarry.
outcome: Grigsu psychologically damaged; died near Quarry
chronicler_notes: Private documentation acquired posthumously. Traumatic content. Restricted access recommended.

key_participants: The Boss/Hayley; Truck; Gull; Polks; Black Yeller; White Yeller; Three Yeller Men
description: Creature-collecting expedition organized by 'The Boss' ended in catastrophic violence. Boss beheaded by Black Yeller who also killed White Yeller and three Yeller Men. Truck's face destroyed in cave.
casualties: Boss (beheaded); White Yeller (beheaded); Three Yeller Men (beheaded); Truck (killed); multiple expedition members
chronicler_notes: Single survivor (Gull) account. Magical abilities may have aided survival. Account possibly unreliable.

description: Series of missions from Capital to Mirado region over extended period. Purposes varied: diplomatic reconnaissance trade military.
chronicler_notes: Multiple events consolidated. Individual mission records fragmentary.

description: Keth's 'Topology as Prophecy' predicts accelerating instability in Western Dens by Year 950.
chronicler_notes: Prediction not yet testable. Keth's historical accuracy claimed at 91%.

description: Keth's 'Topology as Prophecy' predicts the Capital itself may become unstable by Year 1000.
chronicler_notes: More controversial prediction. Capital instability would be unprecedented.

description: Period when Cartographer's Guild significantly revised protocols for Dens mapping. Current Dens Principles date from this revision.
chronicler_notes: Protocols remain in effect. Seventh Survey established current methodological framework.

key_participants: Twenty-Ten Technical Assessment Group; Vorn Kellam; Pria Senth; Murchison Toller
description: Period of active skeptical assessment of scholarly claims by Twenty-Ten group. Multiple methods and scholars evaluated.
outcome: Calibration standards established; several claims debunked
chronicler_notes: Skeptical movement's peak activity period. Kellam's First Rule formalized.

key_participants: Tennev Crost; Jackson (JK-3847); Capital Educational Institute
description: Research project attempting to predict student outcomes. Jackson (JK-3847) broke the prediction model by being a 'reflexive subject.'
outcome: Model failure; Key insight: 'You cannot model freedom'
chronicler_notes: Bridges W1 scholarly world and W2 institution. Jackson's anomalous nature confirmed.
